node.title: Coronial inquest into Theo Hayez's mystery disappearance to begin in Byron Bay
node.alt: A young man wearing a green t-shirt.
node.description: An upcoming coronial inquest into the 2019 disappearance of Belgian backpacker Theo HayezÂ will visit key locations in Byron Bay and hear from a number of overseas witnesses
node.content: ["The New South Wales Coroner investigating the disappearance of an 18-year-old Belgian backpacker in Byron Bay two and half years ago\u00a0will visit a number of key locations on the first day of the upcoming two-week inquest.\u00a0", "Theo Hayez was last seen leaving the Cheeky Monkey's nightclub on Jonson Street on May 31, 2019.", "Mobile phone data revealed he travelled in a direction opposite his hostel\u00a0and through dense bushland to Cosy Corner at Tallows Beach, below the Cape Byron lighthouse.", "He has not been seen or heard from since.", "The mystery has sparked international attention and had a profound impact on many north coast local residents.", "In a post on social media, the teenager's godfather Jean-Philippe Pector said Theo's mother, father, brother and grandmother would be travelling to Australia to attend the coronial inquest, which begins on Monday,\u00a0November 29.", "He said he and Theo's cousin\u00a0would also be travelling interstate for the inquest.", "A preliminary meeting of the parties \u2014 or direction's hearing \u2014\u00a0heard a large number of overseas witnesses were expected to give evidence via audiovisual link.", "The Coroner's Court heard fellow Belgian backpacker\u00a0Antoine Van Laethem, who stayed at the WakeUp! Hostel with Theo and was with him at the nightclub on the night he disappeared, is expected to be a \"significant witness\"\u00a0in the inquest.\u00a0", "The first day will be\u00a0opening statements with\u00a0reference to a \"large amount of audiovisual material\"\u00a0in addition to viewing \"some of the key locations\".", "Witnesses are expected to begin giving evidence on the second day of the inquest.", "There may also be a second hearing early next year, which will look at ways to streamline and improve access to data from multi-national companies in missing persons' cases.", "The Coroner's Court this morning heard there had\u00a0been a number of legislative and COVID-19 related obstacles around international witnesses and data."]
